name: JsonRestApi.Request

aliases.name: Config
aliases.comment: Basic settings for how URLs are constructed with dynamic data and requests are made. Constructed using `config`.
aliases.type: { decoder : Json.Decode.Decoder resource , encoder : resource -> Json.Encode.Value , toBaseUrl : urlBaseData -> String , toSuffix : urlSuffixData -> String , updateVerb : JsonRestApi.Request.Verb , headers : List ( String, String ) }

values.name: config
values.comment:
Constructor for a Config.

    articleApi : Request.Config Article () String
    articleApi =
        Request.config
            { decoder = articleDecoder
            , encoder = encodeArticle
            , toBaseUrl = (\_ -> "http://www.example-api.com/articles")
            , toSuffix = (\id -> "/" ++ id)
            , options = []
            }
values.type: { decoder : Json.Decode.Decoder resource , encoder : resource -> Json.Encode.Value , toBaseUrl : urlBaseData -> String , toSuffix : urlSuffixData -> String , options : List JsonRestApi.Request.ConfigOption } -> JsonRestApi.Request.Config resource urlBaseData urlSuffixData

values.name: create
values.comment:
Trigger a HTTP `POST` request, which, if successful, returns a `msg` parameterized with the created `resource`.

    case msg of
        CreateRequest newArticle ->
            ( model, Request.create articleApi newArticle () CreateResponse )
values.type: JsonRestApi.Request.Config resource urlBaseData urlSuffixData -> resource -> urlBaseData -> (Result.Result Http.Error resource -> msg) -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: delete
values.comment:
Trigger a HTTP `DELETE` request, which, if successful, returns a `msg` parameterized with the deleted `resource`.

    case msg of
        DeleteRequest article ->
            ( model, Request.delete articleApi article () article.id DeleteResponse )
values.type: JsonRestApi.Request.Config resource urlBaseData urlSuffixData -> resource -> urlBaseData -> urlSuffixData -> (Result.Result Http.Error resource -> msg) -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: getAll
values.comment:
Trigger a HTTP `GET` request, which, if successful, returns a `msg` parameterized with a `List` of all `resource`s.

    case msg of
        GetAllRequest ->
            ( model, Request.getAll articleApi () GetAllResponse )
values.type: JsonRestApi.Request.Config resource urlBaseData urlSuffixData -> urlBaseData -> (Result.Result Http.Error (List resource) -> msg) -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: header
values.comment:
Create an option, to be passed into `config`, specifying which HTTP headers should be added in requests.
`"Accept: application/json"` is included by default.

    articleApi : Request.Config Article () String
    articleApi =
        Request.config
            { decoder = articleDecoder
            , encoder = encodeArticle
            , toBaseUrl = (\_ -> "http://www.example-api.com/articles")
            , toSuffix = (\id -> "/" ++ id)
            , options =
              [ Request.header "Max-Forwards" "10"
              ]
            }

values.name: update
values.comment:
Trigger a HTTP `PUT` or `PATCH` request, which, if successful, returns a `msg` parameterized with the updated `resource`
`PUT` is used by default. `PATCH` can be used by passing the result of `usePatchForUpdate` into `config`.

    case msg of
        UpdateRequest article ->
            ( model, Request.update articleApi article () article.id UpdateResponse )
values.type: JsonRestApi.Request.Config resource urlBaseData urlSuffixData -> resource -> urlBaseData -> urlSuffixData -> (Result.Result Http.Error resource -> msg) -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: usePatchForUpdate
values.comment:
Create an option, to be passed into `config`, to make updates to a resource using the `PATCH` verb.
`PUT` is used for updates by default.

    articleApi : Request.Config Article () String
    articleApi =
        Request.config
            { decoder = articleDecoder
            , encoder = encodeArticle
            , toBaseUrl = (\_ -> "http://www.example-api.com/articles")
            , toSuffix = (\id -> "/" ++ id)
            , options =
              [ Request.usePatchForUpdate
              ]
            }

name: JsonRestApi.Response
comment:
This module provides time-saving helpers for updating `resource`s from HTTP responses. To be used with `JsonRestApi.Request`.

Collections should be modeled as `RemoteData Http.Error (List resource)`.

# Response Helpers
@docs handleGetIndexResponse, handleCreateResponse, handleUpdateResponse, handleDeleteResponse

values.name: handleCreateResponse
values.comment:
Add a new `resource` to a `RemoteData Error (List resource)` if the `Result` is `Ok`.

    case msg of
        CreateResponse result ->
            ( { model | articles = Response.handleCreateResponse result model.articles }, Cmd.none )
values.type: Result.Result Http.Error resource -> RemoteData.RemoteData Http.Error (List resource) -> RemoteData.RemoteData Http.Error (List resource)

values.name: handleDeleteResponse
values.comment:
Remove the `resource` with the matching `id` from a `RemoteData Error (List resource)` if the `Result` is `Ok`.

    case msg of
        DeleteResponse result ->
            ( { model | articles = Response.handleDeleteResponse result articlesEqual model.articles }, Cmd.none )
values.type: Result.Result Http.Error resource -> (resource -> resource -> Bool) -> RemoteData.RemoteData Http.Error (List resource) -> RemoteData.RemoteData Http.Error (List resource)

values.name: handleGetIndexResponse
values.comment:
Replace a `RemoteData Error (List resource)` with a new list if the `Result` is `Ok`.

    case msg of
        GetAllResponse result ->
            ( { model | articles = Response.handleGetIndexResponse result model.articles }, Cmd.none )
values.type: Result.Result Http.Error (List resource) -> RemoteData.RemoteData Http.Error (List resource) -> RemoteData.RemoteData Http.Error (List resource)

values.name: handleUpdateResponse
values.comment:
Replace a `resource` with the matching `id` in a `RemoteData Error (List resource)` if the `Result` is `Ok`.

    case msg of
        UpdateResponse result ->
            ( { model | articles = Response.handleUpdateResponse result articlesEqual model.articles }, Cmd.none )
values.type: Result.Result Http.Error resource -> (resource -> resource -> Bool) -> RemoteData.RemoteData Http.Error (List resource) -> RemoteData.RemoteData Http.Error (List resource)
